website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, compact but temperamental keyboard, with a very short lifespan.
pros: Compact design and raised keys are attractive
Heavy build keeps keyboard in place without sliding
cons: Key action and feel is inconsistent across the keyboard
Keys can begin to give out after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: Why does everyone hate you, Taylor?
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's loud and my coworker Taylor hates it. This brings me joy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W. Medders

customer_reviews.title: Redragon Quality
customer_reviews.text: I started using Redragon brand when I needed a new gaming mouse. Haven't looked back! This keyboard is a great mechanical keyboard, especially for the price. Lots of people complain because it is noisy, but what do you expect when you buy a mechanical keyboard?! I have nothing bad to say except I wish I would have bought the back-lit one for the extra "cool" factor. My boyfriend has owned the back-lit red version for over a year now and no wear and tear. I expect the same out of this one as it has not broken or shown any problems yet. Photo is of my Redragon setup!
customer_reviews.author: Adam McLimans

customer_reviews.title: This is the loudest review I've ever typed. (iMac compatible.)
customer_reviews.text: I expect this is my first mechanical keyboard because I've never had anything louder than this.. clackity clack.. clack. Might also be the heaviest keyboard I've ever had.. it sits completely planted. The key feel, the noise, the robustness, all work to change the typing experience in a positive way for me . I like this product. (note: does not improve spelling). I ordered the white one and using it with my iMac. Volume function keys work too. Must be the most opposite keyboard from that stupid chiclet one Apple provides which they call "magic". tenkeyless was 30 bucks.. don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warner

customer_reviews.title: lasted only 3 month.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this was due to the high amount of good reviews, and it fits my keyboard slide out tray. but the A key stopped registering most of the time. I even disassembled the keyboard to clean the dirt out and still no luck. Save your money get something of better quality so it'll last. This only lasted me 3 months, total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BO

customer_reviews.title: It’s a cheap mechanical keyboard and that’s all it needs to be
customer_reviews.text: I go through keyboards like nobody’s business. Last year I wrote about 600,000 words for work. I genuinely mess up the electronic boards of my keyboard because I type hard and fast and a lot. This isn’t the fanciest keyboard in the game or the smoothest. The keycaps are not fancy. There’s no gimmicks. What it is is cheap and reliable and easy to use. This is my favorite brand of keyboard specifically because I know what I’m getting. I’d recommend this to anyone looking to get into mechanical keyboards who wants something that’s easy to set up and use, without any bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Author Sable Sylvan (Heather Davies)

customer_reviews.title: My beautiful introduction into mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing. All of the cheaper end mechanical keyboards have LED lights built in that make it impossible to sleep if the keyboard is in your room. I don't need my keyboard to shine all colors of the rainbow, I need it to be functional and feel good to use. This thing is both of those. Each keypress is super satisfying and I will never voluntarily go back to standard keyboards afterwards. It has a very satisfying weight and even dim LED lights to show you if caps lock is on, etc. I cant find a single flaw! Even came with a cool sticker.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effective, works as intended. My only question will be on longevity, in that they use knock-off Cherry Blue switches and I'm unsure how long they'll last. Previous experiences with Cherry switches are that they last for a very long time and are solidly built (Corsair K65 being what I use currently), so I'm interested in seeing how well this keyboard holds up. However, for the pricepoint, it certainly delivers and is replaceable without breaking the bank (unlike the K65, lol). Unlike the K553 Redragon keyboard, this has a really easy-to-read font on the keycaps. If one is looking to get a budget mechanical board, this might be worth looking into.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clicks loud, but good.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Razer blackwidow, but I was looking for a more compact keyboard. I recently bought a mouse from Redragon and was pleasantly surprised. I decided to take a gamble and purchase this keyboard, mainly because it reminded me of old school keyboards, plus it looked really nice. It is loud, but it’s just as loud as my razer. Clicks can feel slightly cheap, but it is a mechanical keyboard, not a “feel”. If you are on the fence about IT, don’t be. It’s a good choice and you can’t beat the price. Side note: I do stream and use a Blue Yeti. My audience/friends can barely hear the clicks, plus it doesn’t phase them.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence Scarano

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Razer Blackwidow Chroma from 2014 to the beginning of 2020. RIP. MTN Dew took you from me too soon. Anyway, I bought this keyboard as an interim, cheap and mechanical, while I figured out what new keyboard I wanted (TKL at least). It's been 4 months and I have stopped looking for keyboards. This thing is honestly pretty nice all things considered. Only downside is that the keys have a bit of spring noise if you really mash at em. But I wear big noise cancelling headphones, so unless I'm showing someone something, it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 20$ keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Great peoduct, i got the blue key switches and found that it was too noice to use in the same room as my gf though i love the sound i will probably switch to reds. Definetly more travel disrance than i am use to. Keyboard has a good quality feel, happy with my purchase. You pay for what you get, and I will be looking into higher quality products at a higher price range, though if this is your price range i would absolutely recommend this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great budget mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for a budget gaming build I was doing to play some older or less demanding games (WoW Classic, CS:GO, Halo MCC, etc) and it's performed quite well. I'm by no means a keyboard connoisseur but I've used some pricey mechanical keyboards extensively in the past and this meets my expectations with tactile feel and durability. It feels solid and responds well in a variety of games. Also a pleasure to type on. Sometimes I miss a numerical keypad but I prefer the smaller footprint of this frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming - more room for mouse and very Durable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has lasted everyday of pc usage since......." You purchased this item on February 28, 2017. " If you want a gaming keyboard that will last it has done the job for me. Now I am probably going to buy another for a backup for 27 dollars its 100% worth it. All my keys still work and what I like about this keyboard is the windows key is normal sized - not that little half cap size which makes it easier to push for my games.
customer_reviews.author: ChaosUnleashed

customer_reviews.title: Clicky and no flex! Definitely one of the good ones out there for under $30
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use this for gaming. I got this for coding and I love it! This review is 3 days in with at least 4-5 hours of use and so far so good the keys are good quality. I’m definitely upgrading the keyscaps because I plan to use stickers for shortcuts. I plugged it into my raspberry pi and it works perfectly fine. Coming from a dongle the response time is amazing. For the money it’s definitely worth it! You get your foot in the door with this keyboard meaning you’ll know what you’ll want and not want after using this. I don’t want windows keys if I’m using Mac bit with this keyboard you can swap out the keyscaps.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Garrido

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic board at a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's moderately loud, clacky and immensely satisfying to use. I have a hard time going back to a membrane keyboard and this is an entry level board, but you'd never be able to tell. The board is super solid and will not slide around no matter how ragey you get when you play video games or type. While the keys have a bit of side motion, they don't detract from the great typing experience that this keyboard gives. I do suggest you get the backlit keyboard with a number pad version however, as these keys are wearing down a tiny bit, and a number pad would be convenient. This should be your entry level mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hohe

customer_reviews.title: Second time buying this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The blue switches are loud but they are swappable. You can replace them without soldering or anything. I will add you can easily get rid of the god awful logo with a little sandpaper and about 60 seconds. Just hit it with some 400 grit or higher and it will rub right off, it looks factory finish without the logo. Improves the look 100% IMO. Font is much more "grown up" on the version without the backlight, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G.

customer_reviews.title: Considering Price, It's Great
customer_reviews.text: Been awhile since I had a mechanical keyboard, and while it is noisy I do enjoy the FEEL of solid keys that have deep travel and click. It's plastic, as expected for the price, but very sturdy. I like that the keys on my model do not light up. Don't care for that. All in all, if you're looking for a simple and affordable mechanical keyboard that looks clean - this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Timsah

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent for 27$. Enter key is off
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good feel. Not the best feel for a mechanical but you get what you pay for. The only 2 things I find off about this is that the Enter key is sticky feeling and requires a different amount of force than the other keys. It's very odd. I don't know if this is a defect with my specific keyboard, and if so it speaks to the quality control. The other thing I don't quite fancy is the red "REDDRAGON" logo above the arrow keys. Also of note, the box has a picture with hideous red letters but thankfully the keyboard has the white letters.
customer_reviews.author: rhep

customer_reviews.title: Best mech keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: The clicky-clacky mechanical keyboard is so satisfying. If you are very sensitive/picky to a specific mech keyboard (e.g., brown, blue, red, who knows other colors keys), this may not be the one. I only enjoy the feedback feeling when pressing the button and the mechanical keyboard sound. The keyboard feels heavy and sturdy. For the price, this is a good buy keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: EGEL URIP

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought the non back-lit keyboard with some hesitation due to the mixed reviews but after about three months of constant use I have to say its a really well made keyboard! Nothing has gone wrong with the keyboard mechanically. No keys have gone out or stopped working. But but physically the B key has worn a little due to me using it constantly. But in all its a great keyboard and I don't regret the purchase. UPDATE: March 8th 2019. Have had this keyboard for 8 months and so far it is holding up great and none of the keys have faded and all of the keys also are still functional and work great.
customer_reviews.author: 4AGE20V

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, dead after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the 2 months that it worked. I have never had a keyboard go out on me so quickly, I was a bit surprised. Sure enough it is dead after 2 months of moderate use. It appears to not even be receiving power. Anyways, I will be purchasing a little bit of a higher end keyboard to avoid this, especially since the return period has ended.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Nice mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good mechanical keyboard, but didn't want to spend an arm and a leg. This works quite well. I'm still getting used to the 3/4 layout, but our keyboard tray just doesn't have the room for a full keyboard and mouse. I'm happy with how this has been performing. It's easy to disassemble and clean when needed, as well. Good key action and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, very solid and clicky!
customer_reviews.text: I love the clickity-clackity of a mechanical keyboard! Not sure my co-workers do. . . So far it's great but only one day. Its immensely satisfying to type on this thing. Very response, heavy, good build, stays in place. I do have a wrist pad for it though because it's tall but so are all other mechanical keyboards. Great product, super super happy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Deez

customer_reviews.title: Solid Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a well-built mechanical keyboard for a Linux box I use for programming, and this keyboard was a great choice. It is nice and "clicky" with audible feedback and crisp button break. The keyboard is heavy and feels well built. My only complaint is the prominent logo and the fact that it wasn't backlit, but I knew what I was getting and didn't want to spend the extra money. I'm thinking of buying a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Blake G.

customer_reviews.title: Keys feel good, Ping not so much
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard - I was super excited to try it. Right out of the package, I loved how the keys felt. But when I went to test it out, I noticed a very annoying, very loud high-pitched "ping" on the Enter, Right Shift, Left Shift, Space, \, P, G, and Fn keys. I did some research to find out if this is fixable and the long answer short is "no" unless you're skilled at taking apart and fixing these. I would have been okay with this keyboard if the ping wasn't on keys so frequently used - particularly Space. I'm returning this keyboard ASAP. :(
customer_reviews.author: A. Jayne

customer_reviews.title: feels great. I like this thing a lot so far, edit almost 2 years with maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: Edit 2: i bought this keyboard back to life with a simple cleaning. And it's coming up on 2 years of use. Edit: Too bad this keyboard didn't make it a year. Some keys don't fire randomly and it returns invisible characters that caused compiling errors in a project. Switches are BLUEs fyi, contrary to what description says. and I prefer them, feels great. I like this thing a lot so far. It's no nonsense and the keycaps are a classic style. I don't think this price can be beat. The version i got is without LED underlighting which i prefer as well.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. It hits all the checks boxes when looking for a mechanical style keyboard. Has outemu blues which is very clicky and loud but extremely satisfying to type on. The build quality is very good and seems like it will last the test of time. I have been using it as a daily driver for a few months now and have not had any problems. I will note, the one I purchased does not have led back lighting and that is my one regret. I knew that when I bought it so that was my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: The right normcore mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard, for its price. It is relatively lightweight, not metal board inside but still sturdy. The blue switch is not Cherry MIX but does the job very well, just the right feel you want from blue switches. The keycaps wear quickly though. After one week's heavy use some letters on the caps are already faded (e and n, for example). I have used it for a month, and I think I type about 10000 words per day, so far every key holds up well. It is surely not a fancy keyboard at $200, but for those who just want a normcore mechanical keyboard and gets your typing job done, it is the perfect one.
customer_reviews.author: a1

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and loud
customer_reviews.text: If you are not familiar with a mechanical keyboard just like me, the keyboard uses Cherry MX Blue Switch, which gives you a tactile bump as well as an audible click. I originally bought it for the office use, but decided to use it at home instead because it is so loud. And, I bought quieter mechanical keyboard with Brown Switch for the office. I enjoy using it for typing. As long as it does not bother anyone, I like the loud clicking sound myself. It reminds me of old typewriter.
customer_reviews.author: Slowbut

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, compact and clicky!
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a slow treadmill computer setup. Needed a smaller size keyboard with good feedback when hitting keys. I pulled off the capslock and windows key covers with the provided tool to prevent accidental pressing. I rarely press them and I can still use them if needed without the key cover.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Jordan

customer_reviews.title: If buying for a kid, get ready for a little resistance
customer_reviews.text: This is a small-footprint, good quality, mechanical keyboard. You, or your kid, may be used to thin, "membrane" keyboards with a short throw (key action) and very, very quiet sound when a key is pressed and a mushy feel. This is NOT that kind of keyboard. It is small in footprint on a desk. It has mechanical keys. It will be "clackity" a bit. You will know when you've typed a key. It gives wonderful keyboard response and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: 5littlepeas

customer_reviews.title: real-deal mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for the serious, unequivocal sound of a definitive "click", this is it. Not for the tepid or feint of heat keystroke...this thing clearly declares a keystroke has been made. Sturdy, heavyweight, compact overall design (without the worthless extra keypad) but with full-size keys. Not for use in library or apocalyptic "A Quiet Place" circumstances...
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Decent key response for straight typing, but less substantial than some other gaming boards.
customer_reviews.text: I use it strictly as a typing keyboard. I type at a speed of about 125 words per minute and have used gaming keyboards, because they are typically heavier and more sturdy than regular typing keyboards. For the price, this keyboard is okay for typing, at least in the short run. The key response is good, but the keyboard is a bit lighter and flimsier than the other gaming keyboards I've used, so it remains to be seen how well it will hold up for my typing needs.
customer_reviews.author: C. O.

customer_reviews.title: Good mechanically - keycap paint is terrible
customer_reviews.text: It's a compact keyboard with sturdy construction and nice tactile feedback. I put some O-rings on my keys to make it a little quieter, and it worked out nicely. However, I've only been using the keyboard for ONE DAY and the paint on the keycaps is already starting to wear off. I suspect that after a month, the keycaps will be bare. Notice the "D" "M" and "E" keys etc. in the photo
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Double 0-ring makes this keyboard sound like raindrops.
customer_reviews.text: MX Blue for $20, unbeatable. Was going to return it though due to noise complaint (next-door cubicles) but I bought some cheap O-rings and double ringed mine. Now this keyboard sounds like raindrops hitting a tin roof! You hear the click but not the clack! Perfect for typing/gaming, not recommended for streaming. (might get too loud especially if your mic is on the table)
customer_reviews.author: The Truth Guru

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sure beats the hell out of a non-mechanical keyboard, and being able to deactivate the windows key for gaming is a nice touch (I used to pry it off my regular keyboards). The only thing it needs is to be able to do the same with caps lock (I have the keycap removed from it). Not quite the quality you get from a high end mechanical keyboard, but at this price you definitely can't complain. I originally purchased as a hold over until I got some extra money for something nicer but I really see no reason to replace it now.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable real mech. Loud, though.
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with this board coming from a Razer black widow tournament edition, good keyfeel and texture on the plastic, no gamery font, extremely affordable. My only complaint is that it is a bit loud even for me considering I don't usually mind a loud keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bayly Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.  No EMF!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as the one with the lights have a ton of EMF. I checked with my EMF meter. I like the lights, but detest the EMF and it hurts my hands after a while. No EMF on this one, I am very pleased to get this one without lights as I love the keyboard action.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: While they aren't Cherry MX Blues, they are blue knockoffs (Otemu Blues) they're very similar stat wise in terms of actuation and force needed to press the key. The only thing I have noticed that's different between the two key switches is the Otemus are a tad more wiggly than the MXs. Finding a 10-keyless mechanical that's cheap while being durable is a struggle, but this keyboard is the most bang for your buck. TL:DR: Durable, cheap MX Cherry Blue knockoff that happens to be in a perfect 10-keyless platform. Only concerned is key wiggle that isn't that noticable unless you're really looking.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nascimento

customer_reviews.title: Entry level typist keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work. The blue switches are nice for typing and very comfortable--much better than the membrane wireless keyboard my work supplied me with. I wish it wasn't 10keyless, but it is designed as a "gaming" keyboard where the 10key isn't really useful and can be annoying in fact so I can't dock any points for that, though I highly question WHY they would put BLUE switches on a "gaming" keyboard. If you really want a gaming keyboard, look for one that has the cherry mx red switches.
customer_reviews.author: Carfo

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Well constructed: it's quite heavy and does not move around on my desk. - Great to type on: the keys feel great and are satisfyingly clicky Cons: - No number pad: This might be a pro if you're looking for something small. I didn't think I would mind the lack of a number pad, but I miss it. - Loud: If you have never owned a mechanical keyboard know that they are much louder than a normal keyboard. I would not recommend it for a shared space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not take up very much desktop real estate, great "feel"
customer_reviews.text: A nice "clicky" keyboard without the mostly unneeded number keys. I like the feel of this keyboard. It is full size without being full size (sans num pad). There are a very few times that I would like lights on the keys, but we have this wonderful new invention called the light switch, and I prefer my bank account to be fatter by a few shekels. It's nice to have more desktop real estate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who knew a Gaming Keyboard would be requested by our in-house General Counsel?!?!?!  FOR WORK!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was specially requested by our General Counsel because he loves the sound of the keys! And it totally does the job. He's very happy with it and if it doesn't drive everyone else in the office crazy we might just be ordering more of them. A good keyboard at a very good price. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LovinMaui

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased at least 10 keyboards in the past and this is very likely one of my longest standing keyboards. It's cheap enough that you don't need to worry about it too much, and you get all of the needed functionality. This is my go to budget board from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, feels great, satisfyingly clicky, good for gaming......BUT.....Keyboard stopped working properly after a few months. Right hand keys below home row work sporadically. I’m outside of return window so I need to buy a new keyboard....lame
customer_reviews.author: N cox

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for people like me who likes to see a clutter free desk.
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me who prefer clutter free desk or easy to organized and cleaning then I suggest getting this keyboard. The keyboard's size fits your need, it's small factor means you have increase more room on your desk, how the keyboard is curve makes it a comfortable for typing; I do I a lot of computer programming so this is a nice feature to have, and I love how it's an inch 1/2 higher off the ground really great for when you're cleaning your desk.
customer_reviews.author: John E

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for 2 years and I definitely love it. I've tried other mechanical name brand keyboards like from Corsair, Steelseries, Razer, etc. yet I still love this keyboard more than any of them. Typing on this just feels so satisfying and same with gaming on it. Though, after about two years I'm having some problems with the Q and F key not registering the first time pressing down. So I think sometime soon I may try to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: fubely

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for general computer use, not gaming. The quality seems great. I have no complaints except that it gives a loud clicking sound for each key. My husband says this is a popular feature now.... I'd prefer a quiet one. But it works great and doesn't slide at all on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Knopf

customer_reviews.title: Great switches, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I use it exclusively for typing, I don’t like the keyboards at work so I bought this one to take with me, it’s small enough to fit in my backpack, I’ve never tried Cherry switches, but these switches are excellent, I really like the clickyness and the audio feedback, but it’s loud, it may annoy coworkers. The other thing is it looks cool and the price is right. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for modding!
customer_reviews.text: The model I received had hotswap sockets installed, which would allow for the switches to be swapped out with other Outemu branded switches. You can also desolder the sockets completely and replace them with other switches easily!
customer_reviews.author: Ear bud lover

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard, great key feel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard for a good price. Nice and compact, and the keys feel great. They are blue switches, so consider it if in a really quiet office or something, but I have one at home and one at work and I'm really happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Letters on keys.
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of light use, the letters on the keys were getting very hard to read. I am a 'hunt and peck' typer so seeing the letters is very important to me. The letters were 'dark' to start with and just got fainter. Bad design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: J. Casalino

customer_reviews.title: Great Kb for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Pro’s - Great keyboard for this price, the keys are very clicky and solid. Rubber stoppers on the bottom make the keyboard rock solid, no sliding. Cons- Keys are very close to each other, if you have big hands it will take a few to get used to. You will have finger cramps Lol Also lets say if you sprint with ‘Shift’, if you’re not pressing that key all the way down, a slight lift up will disengage the key.
customer_reviews.author: Zay

customer_reviews.title: For 20 bucks I can't believe I got a keyboard this good.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been using this (the non-RGB) for about a week and it is flawless. I like how it is less wide without the number pad so it is perfect for gaming. I am getting used to hearing the clicks not only to make sure I press the button fully during a game but also because I am a writer and it is nice to have that old typewriter sound/feel to it. Doesn't take long at all to get accustom to it and you won't regret the purchase. (Heavy gamer here, Twitch, YouTube and more- All FPS games.)
customer_reviews.author: An Honest CustomerTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, Mechanical Keyboard, Gaming Only
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I needed a shorter keyboard, and thought that a gaming keyboard would be better. I don't think the performance is any better than a regular keyboard, and it's a heck of a lot noisier. I'm not sure why even gamers would WANT the incessant clicking noises when they are gaming... to each their own, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Collum

customer_reviews.title: Premature keycap wear
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has "mechanical" keys as advertised, and the feel is positive -- exactly what you want in a gaming keyboard. However -- after just two weeks of use, the lettering on the most highly-used keys is fading badly. I figured "my hands aren't that dirty", so to be sure I wiped them clean with a damp rag. No change. The caps on the old keyboard that this was supposed to replace still have highly-visible lettering after a few years of hard use. Now, I think I understand why folks get the backlit version(s) of this keyboard -- you can see the lettering.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed how it typed and felt
customer_reviews.text: Was my first mechnical keyboard, i wasnt expecting the typing action to be so so loud. I enjoyed how it typed and felt, but it was too noisy and we have thin walls and I work from home early and was disturbing the wifes sleep with the chakkachakkachakka. I returned it and bought a mushier feeling but much quieter normal keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard impressed me right out of the box, the feel of the keys and posture of the keyboard itself. The keys are exactly like Cherry MX switches and have the same feel. Very impressive keyboard for the price and definitely look forward to being a customer in the future!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: In two weeks the letters are wearing off, and I just use it for Facebook etc.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent IBM Selectric keyboard feel, but I'm shocked to see the letters fading off commonly used keys (like "e" and "d") in just two weeks of light use. I can touch type but I need to double check keys once in a while!
customer_reviews.author: MWebb

customer_reviews.title: Clickity Clack Clickity Clack great key action
customer_reviews.text: What a joy to use. Clickity Clack Clickity Clack the sound and feel are fantastic. I bought it on a whem because of the size and sale price. I love the feeling of the keys as my fingers dance along. My speed and accuracy increased immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wennemar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mechanical keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is super! I purchased the white version and was not expecting that it has ability to switch out MX switches without soldering. Well guess what you can switch out MX switches by popping them out. This is great as it allows you to turn this MX blue to MX any color without hassle.
customer_reviews.author: PiO

customer_reviews.title: Great value mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly solid cheap mechanical keyboard - needed it for a beater. A few considerations: cable is not detachable, keys are similar to Blues (very clicky and loud), there is a model that is not backlit (Black) I purchase the non-backlit (my preference) and there is a section above the arrows that has signal lights for Caps and Num lock. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to people starting out. Have had no issues with ghosting while gaming or typing.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Love the mechanical feel.
customer_reviews.text: The 'label' on keys wear out fairly quickly. I use the left shift and Ctrl a bit. After a couple months, these keys starts to fade. Doesnt impact performance though. Otherwise a great keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Huy

customer_reviews.title: good cheap keyboard
customer_reviews.text: after having this keyboard for a while I can say that it is good for a 30$ keyboard. The switches feel nice but I am buying a new keyboard with different switches. The material does feel cheap. If you are looking for a decent keyboard under 30$ this is the keyboard for you but I would suggest buying a more expensive board that has higher quality. I hope that this review is somewhat helpfull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit loud.
customer_reviews.text: Keys are nicely responsive and easily changeable. The keyboard seems like it'd be easy to clean and maintain. The keys have a nice raise to them that makes it very ergonomic. As it is a mechanical keyboard, it's fine that the keys are a bit "clacky" but these feel a bit louder than a previous mechanical keyboard I owned. The keycaps seem like they're a bit flimsy so I fear that being too rough with removing the keys to change them or clean the keyboard might cause them to break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had a membrane keyboard for a good while and it eventually started having keys that wouldn't respond (WASD). So I felt it was time to upgrade to a mechanical keyboard. And of course I'm on a budget! And this thing fit the bill. Less than $30 dollars. The weight of this keyboard alone is impressive. The clicking of the keys as I type this is absolutely delightful. I will never go back to membrane again haha.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, functional, easy to clean, and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I use it for work, not gaming. Good value and a nice space saver since I don't want to use 10 key. I bought a second one for my 7 year old to use and she type more accurate and faster without strain. Might get a third one in white for the gaming PC
customer_reviews.author: Blergnar

customer_reviews.title: better than my old razer
customer_reviews.text: typing this review on the keyboard as we speak i had a razer blackwidow before this and i would actually prefer this and its cheaper thanks reddragon saving me money great keyboard really
customer_reviews.author: B&M Ranua

customer_reviews.title: The build quality of this keyboard is wonderful, it's heavy and feels incredibly durable
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this keyboard is wonderful, it's heavy and feels incredibly durable. They keycaps are double injection molded and the overall quality just feels very good. The switches feel great, in my opinion pretty much identical to genuine cherry MX switches. If you're not a mechanical keyboard enthusiast I doubt you would be able to tell the difference between these switches and genuine switches. It may not be as nice as much more expensive options (i.e. corsair or logitech), but this keyboard is worlds better than any membrane keyboard you could get at the same price point. Bottom line, this is the best keyboard you're going to get for under $30. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: A purely better typing experience when compared to membrane keyboards.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cheapest-possible mechanical keyboard in replacement of my cheapest-possible membrane keyboard, and I was very satisfied. I don't necessarily type faster with this mechanical keyboard but it significantly improves the typing experience - there's haptic feedback when you press down keys, which is just satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Fred L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to see what the mechanical keyboard craze was about and this seemed to be the best value. I'm impressed by the build quality for under $30. I like the form factor (without the number pad keys). The blue switches are extremely loud, but they have a good feel. This keyboard hasn't revolutionized anything in my gaming experience, but for the money it was an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is surprisingly well built, especially considering its price point. First of all, the construction is amazing. There is no flex in the keyboard whatsoever. The rubber topped feet make it so they keyboard doesn't slip and slide around at all. Although key sound consistency between keys is not all that good, all the keys feel the same when typing. I did not get the backlit version so I cannot speak on those, but this keyboard is an amazing product for its price. I am not at all disappointed, in fact I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a while, but it's had constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while, but it's had constantly problems the last month with a few keys. My 'e' and 's' keys often don't recognize the keystroke, making me constantly have typos when I'm writing. As these keys are some of the most common ones I hit, it seems that the keyboard just doesn't handle wear very well over time, not even a year. Not very impressive longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price: Check Amazing product: Check Do I recommend: Yes You think it might feel flimsy because of the price, but it's a really sturdy keyboard. I've had the non-lighted option for almost two months now, and it's all good still.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved it. I only tried a few keystrokes on ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it. I only tried a few keystrokes on higher end mechanical keyboards for reference, but still. For 30$ I don't think it can get any better. It feels durable and of good quality for me. Loved that the key-removal tool is included. Only been using it for a month, so no notes on durability yet. Did recommend to several of my friends
customer_reviews.author: Juan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is heavy and the keys are quite clicky and mechanical feeling which I like. No spongy keys here. If you like a clicky keyboard then this is one the best that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Kaunas8

customer_reviews.title: Partner's first mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: He uses it for gaming and programming. We got the no LED version and he appreciates that it's no frills. He loves how clicky it is. I appreciate not having LEDs flash in my eyes when I'm trying to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: nice, cheap mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's loud, so be aware of that, but I haven't seen a mechanical keyboard of this quality at this price. It's everything I was hoping for when I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Mac&Joe

customer_reviews.title: My first mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful keyboard. This is my first mechanical keyboard and I'm now entirely sold on the concept. The build quality is solid--this thing is heavy due to its metal body construction. The keys are responsive and the feedback when a key is depressed is satisfying (albeit a bit noisy). Highly recommended for ~$25. Tip: the version without a back light has key caps printed with a standard font--it looks a lot more grown-up/is a bit more subtle than some other gaming keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Friction when typing
customer_reviews.text: The keys are a little crowded, but that's acceptable for a compact size keyboard. the problem is that some "friction" when typing, not the typical resistance expected form mechanical keyboard. not a great experience when typing use this keyboard comparing others.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry.L

customer_reviews.title: The clicking is very satisfying
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the least expensive mechanical keyboards but the quality is very well made. I do not like keyboards with glowing backlight and this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Khanh Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Good with ONE Exception
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mechanical keyboard with one exception. The letters on the keys are so poorly printed that they look gray rather than black. I just ordered keyboard stickers to make them more easily readable. You can get a decent set of these from the Keyboard Company.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Balto

customer_reviews.title: I really love everything about it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever mechanical keyboard. I didn't want to spend a bunch on something that I wasn't sure about and this product fit the bill. I really love everything about it. It's so precise and it makes that awesome mechanical sound. It takes up very little desk space which is great for me. It is smaller than I expected, but this is a pleasant surprise. I'll continue to update throughout the lifetime of the keyboard, day one is A+ though.
customer_reviews.author: tkqrud

customer_reviews.title: This bad boi is loud
customer_reviews.text: If making noise with the keyboard is an issue for you avoid this product. If making noise gives you miniature orgasms then this is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Koblents

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard. Been using it steadily since I got it for my ps4. Wanted a keyboard without any rgb nonsense and this one is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie4Fngrs

customer_reviews.title: Keys feel great. It was thicker than I expected but that's ...
customer_reviews.text: Keys feel great. It was thicker than I expected but that's fine. A major annoyance is the "e" key would not register sometimes. At first I thought it was me but it happens too often and only with a single key. I can only assume that it's an issue. Update: reseating the "e" key fixed the above issues. I'm updating the rating as this is a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Anfernee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic for the price. I have some very expensive keyboards I use for work/programming, but this is the best go-to for gaming and as something that is portable. Heavy but not too heavy, well made.
customer_reviews.author: CoBurnside

customer_reviews.title: Give me a break
customer_reviews.text: Worst most uncomfortable keyboard I've ever used. It's garbage pass on it trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Yardich

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard at a great price
customer_reviews.text: i used to have this keyboard, but in white with a red backlight, it lasted a good couple months before my cat dug it’s claw into the middle and broke it 😂 but i got it again during prime day and i’m so happy with it. i added the keys from the old keyboard to give it a nice look to it. would recommend to anyone trying to find a good keyboard for a low price
customer_reviews.author: thomas j radtke

customer_reviews.title: The key caps starts to fade away in a month...
customer_reviews.text: The key caps starts to fade away in a month... I know for this price I really couldn't ask much but only lasting for a month? But other than the key cap problem it works as what a blue mech keyboard does.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Low emissions
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband and he loves that it is light weight and compact. It has very low emissions to use with his laptop. It has helped tremendously his neuropathy.
customer_reviews.author: Madelou

customer_reviews.title: The tactile feedback of this keyboard is perfect, I make far fewer typing errors due to ...
customer_reviews.text: As a programmer I have been very dissatisfied with modern keyboards. The tactile feedback of this keyboard is perfect, I make far fewer typing errors due to missed keypresses than I would with non-mechanical keyboards lacking the explicit tactile feedback. And when I am in the zone, writing code it sounds cool...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A great entry-to-moderate experience mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Feels great! Live that they have a version without the eye-murdering LED backlight. Connected to my windows 10 PC instantly with no issues. Perfect click. I adore having no ghosting for the first time in years. :) I use it for writing and light gaming and have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Checker Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. 4 stars because it needs a wrist pad.
customer_reviews.text: took me some time to get used to, but now I can't leave it. PUBG experience is great. Typing experience is great as well. Loud keys, but overall very good mechanical feel. It only lacks a wrist pad. I wish it came with one or they offered one for it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Tamez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent layout, needs some bumpers under the keys to make it feel great. I like that they included a key cap puller and that it has 6n key rollover. The only thing that would make this perfect would be ps/2 compatibility. Also sometimes, the keyboard doesn't work well in the bios/ certain non installed OS situations which I believe is due to the fact it is actually detected as 2 keyboards and not one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is by far the best of both worlds when it comes to typing and ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is by far the best of both worlds when it comes to typing and cost. The keyboard works exactly how I would expect it to and feels great when typing. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who's looking for a mechanical keyboard on the cheaper side.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after a bit of use
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with the keyboard for a bit but then started having troubles with it around the 4-month mark. The keyboard every now and again starts going crazy and starts adding extra keys or just doesn't receive input. So sad because I actually liked my first mech keyb.
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard for how much it costs
customer_reviews.text: A good keyboard for how much it costs. I like the feel of the keys except, the clicky mx-blues are really noisy. I even tried 0-rings which didn't help. Going to keep the Redragon as a backup but I already ordered another keyboard that uses mx-browns.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love typing on this!
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking for a mechanical keyboard that wouldn't break the bank. Fortunately I found this and I love it. The keys feel great to push and it has a nice design. Better than I expected for the price!
customer_reviews.author: VincentRenzi

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what she wanted
customer_reviews.text: Incredible product for the price. Daughter wanted small mechanical keyboard and loves this
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn P.

customer_reviews.title: Feels really great, High quality build
customer_reviews.text: BLUE SWITCHES ARE LOUD AF. (you have my warning) blue switches are to mimic key writers from back in the day. Feels really great, High quality build. If too loud for you, you can buy some "o rings" though it makes your keys a lot heavier to press. Great for osu
customer_reviews.author: Linda

product_meta.title: Redragon K552 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 60% Compact 87 Key Kumara Wired Cherry MX Blue Switches Equivalent for Windows PC Gamers (Not Backlit Black)
feature_bullets: 87 Key Mechanical Gaming Keyboard with Custom Switches (Cherry Blue equivalent) for longevity with greater durability and responsiveness offering clicky medium resistance audible loud click sound crisp precise tactile feedback for typing and gaming

Mechanical USB Gaming Keyboard, No Backlight. Small compact mechanical keyboard WITHOUT Backlighting and separate number gaming keypad. Featuring laser etched keycaps offering lettering that doesn't scratch off

Anti Ghosting, ALL 87 keys are conflict free n-Key Rollover for ultimate Gaming performance. 12 Multimedia keys, Non-Slip Ergonomic, splash-proof Design with adjustable typing angle, High-Speed USB cable with gold-plated corrosion free USB connector

Compact TKL Tenkeyless Ergonomic Designed Computer Keyboard Durable Metal-ABS Construction with Plate-mounted mechanical keys and switches that stand up during marathon FPS gaming sessions like league of legends Fortnite PUGB Overwatch Call of Duty

PC Gaming Keyboard Compatibility Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP, Limited Mac OS keyboard support. Works well with all major Computers Brands and Gaming PCs MSI, Dell, Corsair, Alienware, Razer, Xbox One, Asus and others

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,042 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
